titleStmt.title: An honourable speech made in the Parlament of Scotland by the Earle of Argile (being now competitor with Earle Morton for the chancellorship) the thirtieth of September 1641. Touching the prevention of nationall dissention, and perpetuating the happie peace and union betwixt the two kingdomes, by the frequent holding of Parlaments.
titleStmt.author: Argyll, Archibald Campbell, Marquis of, 1598-1661.
Scotland. Parliament. House of Lords.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by A.N. for I.M. at the George in Fleetstreet,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
